author: Kathryn Folliott
title: Big hotel savings by booking three nights or more
text:
Forget the quick getaway. With IHG’s “Three Nights a Dream” promotion, vacations of three nights or more at participating Canadian hotels offer savings worth 15 to 25 per cent. The three nights must be consecutive and paid in full at time of booking. IHG brands include Crowne Plaza, InterContinental, Hotel Indigo, Holiday Inn and Holiday Inn Express. More than 160 properties across Canada are taking part in the deal, from the Hotel Indigo Ottawa Downtown City Centre to the Holiday Inn Express Calgary NW and the Holiday Inn Halifax Harbourview. A minimum six-day advance purchase requirement applies, and rates are non-refundable. Travel must be booked and completed by Dec. 30. See ihg.com/threenights .
Resort credit at Wynn Las Vegas
Air Canada Vacations is giving guests at Wynn Las Vegas and Encore Resort up to $200 in resort credit. The deal applies to air and hotel packages booked through Air Canada Vacations for travel to either property, for a minimum of two nights in select room categories. Bookings must be made by Sept. 30 for stays through Dec. 26. The resort credit can be used towards just about anything, from dining to spa treatments. The amounts ramp up with the length of stay: $50 for two nights; $100 for three nights, $150 for four nights and $200 for five nights or more. See aircanadavacations.com.
Hike through El Yunque rainforest
Gloriously green El Yunque rainforest sprawls across 11,000 hectares in eastern Puerto Rico. Hiking trails abound (and there are waterfalls too). The “Experience El Yunque” package available at the Sheraton Puerto Rico includes a half-day guided walking excursion through El Yunque, complete with bottled water and snacks. The package also includes late check-out, just in case you need extra recovery time after your trek. Rates start at $279 (U.S.) per night, a 30 per cent savings. Weather restrictions may apply, plus there’s a three-day advance booking requirement. See sheratonpuertoricohotelcasino.com/excursion .
Go locavore at Viamede Resort
Chef Kevin McKenna’s nine-course tasting menu at Viamede Resort in the Kawarthas offers locally-sourced food paired with local wines, many from small family-owned wineries in Prince Edward County. The menu is part of a package called “The Locavore” and it’s available until early September. Normally priced at $659 for two people, including one night’s accommodation and breakfast, The Locavore is currently available for a discounted rate of $559 until July 22. Just for Fare Deals readers, Viamede Resort is extending the date for the discounted rate to Sept. 6. Call 1-800-461-1946. For package information see viamede.com.
Best buy of the week
London isn’t what you would call a bargain but admission to many of the city’s top museums, including the British Museum, the National Gallery and the Tate Modern, is free. Deals are also available at visitbritainshop.com. It’s the official shop of the British Tourist Board and visitors can pre-pay and save on theatre passes, tours and the like. Tickets for “The Making of Harry Potter”, a studio tour 30 kilometres outside of London, come with return bus transportation. See visitbritainshop.com.
Kathryn Folliott is a Toronto-based freelance writer. Prices Quote: d are subject to change and availability. Follow @KathrynFolliott.
